title: Calories in an Everything Bagel
meta_description: Discover calories in an everything bagel, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown per bagel with quick tweaks and FAQs.
assumptions: Standard medium size (~85 g), baked fresh, topped with sesame seeds, poppy seeds, dried onion, garlic, and salt; no fillings or spreads.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, size, baking method, and toppings; homemade or store-bought may differ. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: An everything bagel has about 280 kcal, mostly from carbs, with 10 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in an everything bagel?
faqs.a: Approximately 280 kcal for one standard everything bagel.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in an everything bagel?
faqs.a: About 52 g carbs, including 2 g fiber and 5 g sugars.

faqs.q: Is an everything bagel high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 520 mg due to the salty toppings like garlic and onion flakes.

faqs.q: How does size affect calories in an everything bagel?
faqs.a: Smaller bagels (~60 g) have ~200 kcal; larger ones (~110 g) up to 350 kcal.

faqs.q: Are everything bagels healthier than plain bagels?
faqs.a: Similar calories, but everything bagels add seeds for extra fiber and healthy fats.
